title: An end-to-end deep learning pipeline to derive blood input with partial volume corrections for automated parametric brain PET mapping
abstract: Dynamic 2-[18F] fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose positron emission tomography (dFDG-PET) for human brain imaging has considerable clinical potential, yet its utilization remains limited. A key challenge in the quantitative analysis of dFDG-PET is characterizing a patient-specific blood input function, traditionally reliant on invasive arterial blood sampling. tldr: 该论文介绍了一个端到端的深度学习流水线，利用局部体积校正和非侵入性动脉采样模型，自动推导血液输入函数，从而解决了动态FDG-PET定量分析中的关键挑战。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces an end-to-end deep learning pipeline that utilizes partial volume corrections and a non-invasive arterial sampling model to derive a blood input function automatically, addressing a key challenge in quantitative analysis of dynamic FDG-PET.
